column1:
West Bengal: CID today filed supplementary chargesheet in TMC MLA Satyajit Biswas murder case at Ranaghat Court in Nadia district, mentioning BJP Vice President Mukul Roy’s name.

Krishanganj TMC MLA Satyajit Biswas was shot dead during a Saraswati Puja programme in Nadia in Feb
During 5th round of talks at Vigyan Bhawan, farmers' representatives asked the Central Govt to give a pointwise written reply of the last meeting, to which the govt has agreed https://t.co/EzZgHcoHTr
573 more #COVID19 positive cases reported yesterday in Bihar, taking the total count of active cases in the State to 6,145: Bihar Health Department

We will contest on all 234 seats in next Assembly elections. Our politics will be spiritual politics unlike the politics of hatred, currently being practised. We will not slam anybody: Tamilaruvi Manian, political advisor of actor Rajinikanth in Chennai https://t.co/LhMN64w9tb

Chennai: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and Dy CM O Panneerselvam attend an event to mark the death anniversary of AIADMK leader & former State CM J Jayalalithaa. https://t.co/8izwSuW0y0

Tamil Nadu: Rainwater causes flooding in Government Hospital premises in Thoothukudi

"Whenever it rains the hospital entrance gets flooded. Patients & ambulances can't enter from here. The water will drain nearly after 2 or 3 weeks, creating problems for patients," says a local https://t.co/5Vd8CdHTFL

In order to enhance passenger convenience for Kolkata people, Kolkata Metro has decided to run additional services & extend timings of its services from 7th Dec, Monday. Kolkata Metro Railway will run 204 daily services instead of 190 services from Mon-Sat: Ministry of Railways
Nepal: Demonstration held in capital Kathmandu, demanding restoration of monarchy in the country. https://t.co/TFjmKu9U9Z
Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning likely to occur at one or two places over Kerala and Lakshadweep area  from 5th December to 7th  December: Kerala State Disaster Management Authority

High waves in the range of 1.5-3.2 meters are forecasted till 23:30 hours of 5th Dec along the coast of Kerala from Pozhiyur to Kozhikode. Current speeds vary between 47- 64 cm/sec: Kerala State Disaster Management Authority

Squally wind speed reaching 35-45 km/hour gusting to 55 km/hour very likely over Lakshadweep-Maldives & Comorin area, southeast Arabian Sea and along & off south Kerala coast on 6th Dec. Fishermen advised not to venture in to sea during above mentioned period: KSDMA https://t.co/BNtwZQUvgD

Squally wind speed reaching 35-45 km/hour gusting to 55 km/hour very likely over Lakshadweep-Maldives & Comorin area, southeast Arabian Sea and along & off south 
Kerala coast today: Kerala State Disaster Management Authority
New Delhi: Fifth round of meeting between farmers' representatives and the Central government begins at Vigyan Bhawan. https://t.co/L4u2LaTi1r

Telangana reported 596 new #COVID19 cases, 3 deaths and 921 recoveries on 4th December.

Total positive cases in the state rise to 2,72,719 including 1,470 deaths and 2,62,751 recoveries. 

Active cases stand at 8,498 https://t.co/xSYiFDiLon

409 new #COVID19 cases and 642 recoveries reported in #Odisha on 4th December.

The total number of positive cases in the state at 3,20,803 till date, including 3,14,665 recovered cases & 4,320 active cases: State Health Department, Govt of Odisha
Delhi: Union Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar reaches Vigyan Bhawan to hold talks with agitating farmers. https://t.co/7ETV9H1Ztv

Haryana: A woman arrested for allegedly thrashing her mother-in-law in Azad Nagar, Hisar. 
 
Rohtash, Azad Nagar Police Station In-Charge says, “The accused woman was arrested after a video surfaced on social media. A case has been registered under relevant sections of IPC." https://t.co/S132U1t9rA
PM Narendra Modi to lay foundation and perform 'bhumi pujan' for new Parliament building in New Delhi on December 10: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla (file photo) https://t.co/iyuTFonr95

We want to complete rollback of the laws. If the government doesn't accept our demand, we will continue our agitation: Harjinder Singh Tanda, state chief of Azad Kisan Sangharsh Committee, Punjab https://t.co/YHiDYOHf80 https://t.co/rmrWc7rPOW

Delhi: Farmers' representatives reach Vigyan Bhawan to hold fifth round of talks with the Central government on the farm laws. "We want the withdrawal of the laws. We won't accept government's offer to amend the laws," says Harsulinder Singh of Doaba Kisan Sangharsh Committee. https://t.co/sCRT0HjWXQ

A petition has been moved in Supreme Court, seeking directions for refund of the exorbitant amount charged for RT-PCR test by private labs & hospitals & to fix Rs 400 for the test across India. https://t.co/62unnNLoV9
It is our 'Beti Bachao Abhiyan'. Today we will give final shape to it: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Dharma Swatantrya (Religious Freedom) Bill 2020 https://t.co/ZcWIEZpU8R
The phase-3 trials are double-blinded and randomized, where 50% of subjects (participants in the trial) receive vaccine & 50% of subjects receive placebo: Bharat Biotech https://t.co/Ask7G9w1Pm

Covaxin clinical trials are based on a 2-dose schedule, given 28 days apart. The vaccine efficacy will be determined 14 days post the 2nd dose. Covaxin has been designed to be efficacious when subjects receive both doses: Bharat Biotech https://t.co/eT5YybkoLl

Young people are ready to be entrepreneurs & contribute to ‘Aatmnirbhar Jammu-Kashmir’. We've conducive environment, robust grassroot democratic system & talented youngsters armed with new ideas to set up innovative businesses: Governor Manoj Sinha at IIT-2020 Global Summit https://t.co/XTUjkWvyP4

#WATCH | Farmers continue their protest against the farm laws at Delhi-Haryana border in Singhu. 

Fifth round of talks is scheduled to take place between farmers' representatives and the Central government at 2 pm today. https://t.co/cIHpIveOzx
Bihar: Mortal remains of Dineshwar Sharma, Lakshadweep Administrator and former interlocutor to Jammu and Kashmir, reach Gaya, his native place. https://t.co/ocg1ezwEhl

Karnataka: Police detain pro-Kannada activists staging a demonstration at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Chowk in Kalaburagi as part of Karnataka bandh against the formation of Maratha Development Authority. https://t.co/w4skb9brSl
Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan to chair a high-level meeting on Dharma Swatantrya (Religious Freedom) Bill 2020 in Bhopal; chief secretary, DGP to remain present.

Bihar: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) holds protest at Patna's Gandhi Maidan against the Centre's Farm laws.

RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says, "We demand that the Centre repeals the black laws." https://t.co/vBbM1WRlbR
Delhi: Farmer leaders leave from Singhu border for Vigyan Bhawan to hold fifth round of talks with the Central government on the farm laws. https://t.co/dtnVmbU4RT

Delhi: An NGO, United Sikhs organisation sets up medical camp at Singhu border to provide medical assistance to farmers.

“Six doctors are working here with us. Over 2,500 protesters who suffered minor injuries due to barricading & tear gas have consulted us,” says NGO Director. https://t.co/gBzW95t3BB
Jammu and Kashmir: Pakistan violated ceasefire by firing with small arms & shelling with mortars along LoC in Balakote sector at about 11:40 am.
IMA scam case: Former Karnataka minister Roshan Baig (in file photo) granted bail by a special CBI court https://t.co/655ifT1BG9

Tamil Nadu: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam President MK Stalin holds a protest rally in Salem against Centre's Farm laws.

He says, "We went to Court against the laws. Kerala & Punjab have already approached Court. Our CM says he's a farmer first, why has he not taken any step?" https://t.co/Sj0qXx7zSr

Four kgs of charas and 5.35 kgs of ganja were recovered from a house at Sachani village in Kullu, Himachal Pradesh yesterday. One person was arrested and a case registered against him under NDPS Act: Special Investigation Unit, Kullu Police https://t.co/UfQjaFRBuH
Maharashtra: Shiv Sena MLA Pratap Sarnaik summoned by Enforcement Directorate for the third time in connection with raid conducted at his residence, asked to appear on Thursday.

Karnataka: Pro-Kannada activists march from Mekhri Circle towards the Chief Minister's residence in Bengaluru as part of Karnataka bandh protest against formation of Maratha Development Authority. https://t.co/4MavsgYY4p

Farmers' doubts will be cleared in today’s meeting with Centre. In recent meetings, some issues were clarified. It's Opposition's politics, they're instigating the protest. The meeting will be fruitful & we expect farmers will roll back protest: MoS Agriculture, Kailash Choudhary https://t.co/RvXXHJKgJl
West Bengal: A drug peddler was arrested with 3.7 kgs of heroin near Esplanade under Hare Street Police Station area in Kolkata yesterday, say Kolkata Police https://t.co/RIm7EL00IB
#WATCH | Tamil Nadu: Wall of a dilapidated church building collapses due to strong winds in Dhanushkodi near Rameswaram. #CycloneBurevi https://t.co/FCvNqWbZfP

#Delhi: #FarmersProtest at Burari's Nirankari Samagam Ground against recent farm laws enters 10th day.

“We're hoping today’s meeting with central leadership will be positive. We won't stop until govt agrees to our demands. We'll make the movement bigger,” says a protestor. https://t.co/gwtBWITIcg

Haryana minister Anil Vij announces he has tested positive for COVID-19. 

On November 20, he was administered a dose of Covaxin at a hospital in Ambala, as part of its third phase trial. https://t.co/34HVOIRoFK
Earthquake of magnitude of 3.4 at Ritcher scale hit Tezpur, Assam at 10:46 am today: National Centre for Seismology
Union Minister Piyush Goyal also reaches the Prime Minister's residence in New Delhi. https://t.co/fFwmhLFqft
Ahead of the fifth round of meeting with agitating farmers, Union ministers Amit Shah, Rajnath Singh and Narendra Singh Tomar reach PM Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi.

#WATCH | A tractor with DJ system was spotted at Delhi-Haryana border during farmers' protest in Singhu last night. 

"For the past few days, we have been here & there is no source of entertainment for us so we have this tractor installed with a music system," a farmer said. https://t.co/p2r3Ec9Dwb

PM held all-party meeting & now they're saying State & Centre will decide the price, how can it be? In Bihar, they gave assurance that vaccination will be free. We demand vaccine should be given to each Indian free of cost: Maharashtra Minister & NCP leader Nawab Malik

 #COVID19 https://t.co/Y57mqUueC1

I don’t know why Prakash Singh Badal got Padma Vibhushan in the first place. What war did Prakash Singh Badal fight or what sacrifice did he make for the community? Stop politicking on this, these theatrics might have worked 40 years ago but they won’t work now: Punjab CM. (4.12) https://t.co/LKQxhTWwan
